sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of A and B, then find the symmetric difference of the sets A and B. Using your result, prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
